Playing minecraft mobile is already difficult, and players shouldn't be slowed down by the joystick etc. Having to push your finger far away to reach maximum speed gets tiring very quickly and hurts the fingers and screen. This is something that is most likely never going to be added, as it is not a very minecraftish thing. This is more fitting as an add-on. I’m not saying this is a bad idea, just saying it would be very difficult to pull this off as a fully functional & fitting feature of minecraft. Remember, the developers need to take every feature under carful consideration from all point of views.

It would be cool if we could craft it with different wood types for different colors. The different shapes idea is a bit non Minecrafty imo. The spinning around could just be an animation not an actual moving block.

This would go really well with the bamboo wood set, but a simpler version of this idea may fit better with the general Minecraft style. Each lantern should probably be the same shape, but like how carpets on Alpacas create different designs, the dye color should create different designs on the paper. I also like the idea of the lanterns floating, but I’m not sure how that could be implemented in a way that fits. Overall, I can imagine a lot of really cool builds with strings of paper lanterns between buildings or paper lanterns resting on the surface of water.

Maybe the whole floating into the air bit is a bit unminecrafty, however I'm all down for this, maybe even just being able to place them in the air would be cool, and make them unique compared to normal lanterns, perhaps you could place them together and it would make a small string connecting them (kinda like how you can link up hanging signs)

I feel like having it float up would be very hard to get working properly without it feeling buggy and un-minecrafty. I do think paper lanterns would be cool, but probably just as a regular decorative block.

And for the crafting recipe, I think it would be better to just craft the regular plain paper lantern, and then dye it afterwards, which is what they did for candles.

on my behalf, one of my favorite blocks in the game is the lantern. when it was introduced in 1.14, it made the game feel so cozy and i was obsessed with them, and still am. i use them so much in my builds, and they're the most used light block for me out of both full-block and decoration category blocks.

paper lanterns would be a very versatile decoration block that would heavily appeal to self-expression. the way i see it, they would be larger than lanterns but not a full block, and would have the inner cozy, warm light, as well as the paper exterior held up by a bamboo ribbing inner structure-- an excellent use for bamboo besides just being another source of sticks, panda food, and a natural aesthetic. real paper lanterns can sometimes use bamboo for this. the exterior could not only be dyed any color, but there could even be room and potential for creating patterns, like banners. the creative opportunities are huge with this one being so customizable and a lighting source. i am absolutely obsessed with the ability to hang cozy lights over my head, like you'd see in many place with string lights, especially festivals.

i would love to get to use them in Minecraft for so many builds to expand on having cozy hanging lighting in the game, many other would love it too, and quite a handful of people could even connect to experiences they had growing up seeing them, particularly for Lunar New Year and the Lantern Festival-- a big plus for representation.

As much as I like this idea, it sounds like a pretty hard one to pull off. For the light to float and spin, it will have to be an entity, and to be honest, the game is pretty laggy as is. Coloured lighting is also very unlikely to be added to the game, as it would require an entire rewrite of the lighting engine. Chinese lanterns are notorious for being fire hazards, which might be too "dangerous" for Minecraft and the image the Mojang team are trying to create for the game.

I still like the idea a lot, and I think a simpler version could work. If this ever gets added into the game, I hope they remember these lanterns usually have a bamboo frame.

I think these lanterns should have the same width and length as a chest (not a full block). By using a flint and steel the lantern would give a faint glow. This glow would give a pulsating light level of 6 or 8.

I think a hanging version of the paper lantern would be nice. That way if you want to use it for interior design it looks better than a floating block in the middle of the room. The hanging paper lantern would craft as a fully crafted paper lantern in the middle, and then a chain on top. (I think this should down grade the size of the lantern a little probably to the size of a activated conduit)

I think a wall mounted paper lantern would be awesome too. You could craft it similar to my hanging lantern idea. Instead of a chain on top, you can have a fully crafted lantern in the middle and the a tripwire hook on the side. This would downgrade the size of the lantern to fit the wall better similar to a normal lantern. (probably to the size of a conduit)

The floating idea needs to be adjusted better because it might be to hard to code. Thankfully I have ideas.

By placing a lantern on the ground and lighting it will float like you said. But not 3 or 5 blocks in the air. Instead, like a conduit, they can gently float in the block they were placed in. But I do like your parkour idea so I made a compromise. When they are stepped on or jumped on they will bop down one block. When released from the weight, they will float back to there original position.

If you want them to float in the air build up, place, and light it  with a flint and steel your lantern

I think also a non floatable paper lantern could be nice for ground lighting. By placing a crafted paper lantern in the center of a crafting table and then a flint (or stone) any where else can grant you a non floating lantern. By placing these non floatable lanterns on the ground and then lighting them, they will give or light but wont float doe to the flints or stones.

But to find the patterns you’d probably have to either trade with a villager or find it in a chest in different biomes. For example, the cherry tree biome could have a flower pattern whereas the bamboo biome could compose a bamboo leaf pattern. Been trying out the new feature for around 30 mins after updating current world. The following are the answers to the questions. I found 1 template only, and the challenge to get a template I believe is okay. However, I don't find it specifically rewarding or needy to accquire the templates. If I'm on a multiplayer server then the incentive might be slightly larger but currently I'm playing singleplayer and I don't find decoration to armor any appealing nor rewarding to me.  During my quest to get a template, I don't find it specifically adventurous as it was always the same old Minecraft adventure, and to be honest I feel quite bored and pointless to get something purely decorative. No matter what material the templates require, having to get something purely decorative in the first was quite pointless, especially in singleplayer. I do believe some use can be added to each template and their respective materials, so that the incentive is much larger and the adventure can be more rewarding. For example, the sentry trim can give a limited time of resistance effect to the player, with the level of resistance depending on the material being used to make the trim; the spire armor trim put on the helmet can be used to prevent endermen aggressiveness when looking in their eyes, with the chance of prevention increasing as the material used differ. Giving armor trims uses can greatly increase the incentive of getting one and make the game more interesting and creative.
If you ask me, copying smithing templates is way too expensive, especially since armor trims are purely cosmetic. It should be done with something cheaper like gold in place of diamonds.

Please let us use echo shards as well! Its such a pretty color and that would give it another use... Maybe instead of the lapis? Which we can use for enchanting, dye and trading already. 

Echo shards don't have mich use for Hardcore mode players and once you have one or two compasses anyway, you don't use any more shards!

I won't have the chance to check this out for a while longer, but I think it would be neat to be able to apply this to Elytra. Maybe the trims could give unique patterns to elytra, so they can be customized without the need of a cape!

I have an idea to allow for even more customization : being able to use dyes to add armor trims as well. how would this work? by using dyes to dye quartz! this is even something we do in real life. this would work through surrounding a single piece of quartz with your dye of choice and getting dyed quartz as a result. then using it on your armor to make a trim as normal. allowing people to use colors like orange, pink, teal, and green to customize their armor more!

7 diamond for the armour trims feels a little excessive. For the Netherite upgrade you could argue about it being tied to in game progression, but for cosmetics that feels a little unfair comparatively.

The comparison I would like to make is that it costs 8 diamonds to make a diamond chest piece, but would also cost 7 diamonds to add some gold details to some boots (4 diamonds) if you want to copy the pattern first for a total of 11 diamonds. That personally feels too much for what is only a small detail a player has chosen for personalisation.

Adding options for Elytra as well would be a positive too.
Not much feedback to give as of now, but it would be neat if trims could be applied to horse armor and even elytra.

Hmmm...

It also feels kind of weird that so many of the templates require cobblestone to copy them, I feel like there are more unique blocks that could be used instead. 

I really like that you have to go out into the world to find the templates, and they give old and forgotten structures a breath of fresh air that they desperately needed. I think that the rest of game's structures could benefit from having a unique smithing template, especially the dungeon and igloo. For some of the game's rarer structures, perhaps the template should be a guaranteed find in one of the chests - especially the woodland mansion. 

It would be really cool if we could apply these designs to horse armour and especially elytra, as players without capes have no way of customizing their elytras.

I think smithing templates should just be non-consumable. The copying system is tedious and expensive, and it's not very clear how it works without using the crafting guide. Although I think the netherite upgrade template specifically does work as a consumable. Otherwise, fantastic additions!
I personally think that golden trim should count as something that pacifies piglins. I know trims are supposed to be only cosmetic, but that would be rather convenient.

Good news! The armors are finally visible for longer than the skins themselves. But there are two points I see to improve: 1. Pattern design, very poor. Even prevents to see well in some cases what kind of armor is worn. 2. The new objects don't look like from Minecraft, but from a Mod.

Another cool thing would be to be able to customize the elytras because we have no option to own layers, and I've been playing since the Alpha version.
The Armor Stand in the GUI should display the armor piece when you put it in the armor slot even without the material. Also it should be lit from the front (currently it's from the back)

If I had some critical feedback it would be to allow this system to incorporate custom models into armor. It’s currently impossible to implement custom armor models, especially using something like CustomModelData. Now is a perfect opportunity to introduce a better way of creating armor model assets to the game that would be customizable in resource and data packs.

Fantastic overall, armor trim looks great, feels great, very intuitive to use so far. Calling them "Smithing Templates" feels a bit awkward though - calling them blueprints fits the world better and allows for future upgrades for other items

I'm on the camp of "not everything has to have a use, especially if it feels forced, features can just exist for the interaction factor and such", I'm fine with trims being only decorative.
But, with them being so expensive (remember: you have to go out of your way to explore to get them, you have to spend a whole item, sometimes rare ones like diamonds and netherite, you need 8 diamonds to copy them, etc.), I'd ponder making it so that each trim has a small benefit.
This would have to be done carefully, to ensure that trims have specific perks that don't outweigh each other (imo, one of the biggest faults of Minecraft survival is that there is a very linear sense of progression when it comes to gear; tiers don't each have specific niches, there is just one that is 100% better than the last one; leather armor and golden tools being the exception).
Given that this would probably complicate more than it would solve, I think the easier option would be to keep them strictly decorative but make them slightly less expensive. Start by making them not be used up by the smithing table, like banner patterns in looms and/or reversing the copying recipe (8 of whatever material + 1 diamond, it would even visually fit with the templates more).

 

Finally, this is more of a request than feedback: but I would also like if each armour set, regardless of trims, had a somewhat different base shape, making them visually unique, similar to Netherite. Could even help colourblind players!

I think that maybe armor templates shouldn't be destroyed when used but instead, be put into a broken state like an elytra. Then you would, of course, be able to repair them with related materials. I think this would be better than the copy system that is in the current snapshot as with it being possible to copy templates I feel that they lose some amount of value. I mean imagine If you could make copies of music discs; imagine how less rare they would feel if you could just have 20 copies of Pigstep all because one of your friends found a single copy and proceeded to give them out; that would just ruin the point of music discs and I think this same logic applies to templates.

Something that hasn't been addressed here is renewability in SMP servers. As it is, it's far too expensive. Diamonds aren't a renewable resource and neither are naturally generated templates, so there is a bottleneck in the doubling system.

You're limited to the amount of structures that generate (and the templates inside their chests). Even if the community of that particular server manages to always have spare templates to duplicate, getting a ton of diamonds isn't particularly easy, even on endgame, because they can't be farmed. Duplicating lots of templates would require days of manual grinding.

This is a recurring issue in Minecraft. Shulker Shells weren't renewable until Shulker duplication was added to the game and farms could be designed. Before that, server admins would have to reset parts of The End to force Shulkers to regenerate or use modded resources (such as Carpet) to make them spawn naturally.

On another note, I don't think disallowing the usage of the same material of the armor as a trim. That is already possible in survival due to a bug (MC-259356) and it honestly looks quite good.

The Eye trim smithing template poses an issue for Java worlds, in that there are only 128 strongholds in a world. Many servers have already loaded all of their strongholds, which would make obtaining this template impossible. In order to make this item more accessible, I propose that they may be rarely found in the chest contained in the "Fake End Portal" room that exists in some woodland mansions. This way, there is still a way for all players to find one of these templates without making them too easy to find and while still staying thematically appropriate in location.

I LOVE this feature! I have been wanting more personalization on armor for a while, because my custom skin gets covered when I wear armor
.
I like that you have to travel to find templates, but on a multiplayer server it will be very hard to upgrade netherite, and not hard in an engaging way; there just won’t be enough to go around.

I love that for the cosmetic templates you have to travel. It is so rewarding and cool to show off your own armor textures. I’m sad though because in my world with friends we have a world border, so it will be hard to find any :(

My favorite part about this feature is that it costs diamonds to use. Right now, diamonds are essentially useless, because you can trade for diamond tools with villagers. Having a cosmetic use for diamonds is the absolute perfect thing! It is challenging, rewarding, and you can show off to your fiends. I think it’s awesome!

Unfortunately I don’t like the way they look yet. They feel a little clumsy and don’t look particularly cool, except on netherite. I wish I had an idea to make them better but I don really know what it would be.

Overall I love this feature, I love that you need to explore and use diamonds for cosmetics. I like that they are rare but can be duplicated, so you will have to trade with your friends! I LOVE that it costs diamonds. I don’t like that netherite will be rare on multiplayer servers, especially where the border is limited like my server is. What a cool update! So excited!
I think everyone wouldn't mind having trims of the same ore type from the armor. If anything, it would add texture to the armor in question, without changing the colors.

I think it's an amazing feature and I would love to see similar customization even on tools and swords. Another amazing customization function would be ability to change enchantment glint's color (maybe using some upgraded dye). I think it would add a lot of character to otherwise plain and always identically-looking armor and tool sets.

I like the fact that you have to work to get the trims. I can imagine myself going mining to get some diamonds to finally finish an armor set with pretty trimming. I think Minecraft needs these kind of fun things to work towards.
The diamond for for duplication is fine, but I think it should be reversed, with 7 blocks of the base material and 1 diamond.
Make them apply a little buff to the armor or a little buff when a full set of trims is worn.

This is an amazing feature, but I really dislike how the crafting additional trims works. Mainly because the crafting recipe is very needlessly expensive. Just judging from the chances, these templates are incredibly hard to obtain, I mean ~3% per chest for the Snout template? That's crazy, but its good. I like that they're rare. But then having to spend stacks of diamonds to get multiple of them? It doesn't make much sense, it should be easy to get multiple once you've found one.

So here's how I think it should work:

You can find items called "Empty Smithing Templates" by doing basically anything in the world, they'd be found in almost all chest loot, be gotten from fishing, bartering, trading, etc etc. Like how nametags can't be crafted but you can get them from basically everything other method. Combining an Empty Smithing Template with another template and the related block in the crafting table will duplicate it like it does now. This makes it easy to duplicate the templates once you've gotten one, but also makes you still explore and interact with the world if you want to get lots of Empty Smithing Templates.

Important to note: this should only apply to Trims, not the Netherite Upgrade, that using diamonds makes sense and is okay. I think the amount of diamonds should be less but still.

Tool trims! Allow players to create their custom weapons/tools, like the legendary weapons that are known throughout the world in some well-known movies/shows/books, since there seems to be an emphasis on players creating their own stories in their world!

Add Coal to the list of materials you can trim with, with the color being close to pitch black like the coal block.

Add Echo Shards to the list of materials you can trim with, with the color being dark teal without necessarily adding the specks since that'd probably take some coding finesse and honestly not necessary

Add Netherite Scrap to the list of materials you can trim with, with the color being the same brown used in the item
Trims for leather armor, horse armor, and tools

Trims should apply weak positive potion effect depending on the trip material. For example:

  • Redstone Speed 1
  • Emerald Hero of the village
  • Gold Haste 1
  • Diamond Resistance 1 etc

duplicating the templates is WAY too expensive to me. please make them all cheaper, that many diamonds is way too many... to me that's not worth it, whether if I'm upgrading to netherite or doing the cosmetic trims, it's all too expensive, i say lower the price to 3 diamonds per each template

I think there should be a trim from villagers that is gained through trading with a master armorer, similar to how the cartographer trades the globe banner pattern when it's master rank. Only drawback is that it may become a tossup between the helmet, chestplate, or the trim for the final two trades.

Would an animated or otherwise unique trim color when using a rare item such as a nether star be fitting? I feel like if you go through all of the work to kill the wither and then don't even use the drop to make a beacon, it would be cool to show off your riches with, say, an animated RGB armor trim.
Other possible items that could be used would be the dragon egg (probably not) or some rare loot from ancient cities (obviously you aren't meant to try to kill a warden, so they wouldn't drop anything useful). Even something like a new drop from the ender dragon to show your dedication to killing and resummoning it would be cool.

The methods required for setting up custom trim textures/models seems a bit unintuitive; it's only the first version, and I personally haven't gotten to actually making one yet, but it seems like it would just be easier to store them all as separate textures rather than the existing system using an overlay/hue. I understand it being a problem with file sizes, but it can't possibly be so bad that it warrants such a roundabout way of doing it. I'm glad there's finally a way to make custom worn-armor-model textures without overwriting existing ones, but the system could be made easier. This is kind of a problem for spawn eggs too, in my opinion: it's very difficult to add "new" spawn eggs in datapacks due to the hue getting in the way.

These seriously need to work on swords too. tools or even tridents and bows would be really cool too. bows have felt so left out since forever, only being wooden, I’d love to be able to have a trim on it, or a way to change the base colour too like with dye?

I think there should also be a way to get them besides chests, super rare though like 1in1000 from a wither skeleton etc, so people who’ve explored lots of their world can still get these reasonably just through specific grinding
Suggestion: we need a way to demonstrate extreme wealth with this. So use Nether Stars, for a super gay rainbow trim. Maybe make it a shifting pattern too.
Come on Mojang. We need stats with the upgrades.

Make the templates reusable like banner templates so that theyre more of a reusable schematic for designs and upgrades. make using any template cost xp instead of having to clone a template everytime you want to use one. the netherite upgrade specifically should cost ALOT of xp. but the 7 diamond per template copy is ridiculous and feels like tacked on fake difficulty for a cosmetic change, and 7 extra diamonds per piece of netherite gear which just outlandish.

I feel like most of the trims have no reason to be so expensive. Maybe they can use copper or something more available? If the template costs 6 diamonds per piece it feels useless to use one on iron or gold armor. Or go even further, the aesthetic trims don't need to be consumed or duplicated, having multiple uses and durability before they break. This makes them more valuable and easier to use, rewarding adventuring rather than making players pay a ton of diamonds. In terms of more patterns, I think it'd be nice if the armorsmith could trade for an exclusive one. In terms of more materials, I think that the data pack integrations cover most of them, but glow ink sacs would be a great choice, giving players a way to make glow-in-the-dark armor to help themselves be visible in the dark.
Some of the gold trimmings look a little strange, like they look more like butter than gold.

I'm not a big fan of templates being consumables, a casual might find one of these and use it without knowing they can be duplicated, or I could accidentally use the last one I have left. Would I have to make a new expedition for a simple mistake? that's not fun.
They are also a bit tedious to use. If I wanted to compare different pieces of armor with different templates and colors, as it is currently implemented, I would have to make several duplicates of various templates and spend a lot of diamonds to try various combinations. I'd probably research something I like in creative and then do it in survival, but I'd like to be able to find something that suits me in survival.
I think they should be cheaper to use, it's okay that they're hard to come by, but once I have them, I just want to be able to use them and experiment as much as I want, if you charge me to be creative I'll probably only use them once.

I'm very happy that you want diamonds to have more uses and value again, but I don't think this is the way. Maybe, if you guys really want to introduce a cost per use, the templates could have durability (limited but fair amount of uses) and when it hits 0 you would have to repair them with diamonds (just like an elytra, you wouldn't lose it).

Armour trimming is really nice, I like it. but minecraft armour is still too flat I feel like. My idea is to add smithing templates for 3d assets on it, like spikes on the shoulders, and a crest with feathers or horns on the helmet. I would also like the trimming to be possible on weapons and tools.

Templates should be reusable. Cloning the templates using diamonds is just way to expensive for something that is purely cosmetic. The templates should be like the banner patterns so you can use them however many times you want. Also, I may have missed something, but is there a way to remove the trim from your armor right now?

My ideas are:
-emerald: discount with villagers, the greater the more trims you have on the armor.
-lapis lazuli: Increased chance to get a level 3 enchantment. Increases the more trims you have on your armor.
-Diamond, Iron, Gold, and Emerald: Increases the time you can have a beacon effect outside of its range.

But it could be an improvement very small to vision) or it can also have a chance to avoid the warden's effect, higher chance if you have more trims on your armor.
-copper: more likely to be struck by lightning XD
-gold: piglins detect you at less range if you have gold trims, however they will still attack you unless you have a gold armor piece on.
netherite: greater protection (not so much)

I feel that for the price these should be adding a modifier to the armor?

Possibly adding a different attribute per material
but the attribute stacks per piece of the same material armor you wear for full effect

But hey could even be made more complex with different armour materials reacting differently for the material of trim like say gold armour plus redstone trim may give a better overall effect compared to say netherite with redstone trim

That kind of system could really add variety to pvp as players select their armour type and trim to particularly meet their needs of play

Plus since it’s so expensive and or rare it really keeps this a end game modification and keeps the early game progression of iron to gold to diamond etc still intact

The way the menu works is weird and inconsistent with the rest of the game, players should be able to input items before and after adding a smithing template to the smithing table. Small gripe, but immediately found myself frustrated with not being able to immediately shift click in armor.

* Love the changes to enchant glitter. 

* Great balance for challenge/reward. But it can be a bit much for  multiplayer or players on old worlds (like me). Maybe have the wandering traders have a chance to sell the templates. Still incentivized to explore since it would be hard to get the right template via traders, but not impossible for players who don't want to explore 10k+ blocks for, say, strongholds. 

+ It does feel adventurous to search the world

+ The diamond recipe is nice but I feel players are going to accidentally use up the template before knowing that it is single use. Maybe make it work on a durability system but never fully breaks like elytra. And no issues with "Too expensive" (maybe it always costs 5 levels + 1 diamond per use). This is a great addition! Some interesting things I might add are a black / coal version instead of netherite, and a change of color for the enchantment glint, that matches the chosen material of the trim (: Also I think a second layer for the armors, the same way that player skins have two layers, would be incredible, giving more depth to the armors / trims, while also allowing for more creativity from the resource pack artists (:

finding smithing templates is challenging, but by and large just challenging enough. However Vex & Eye plates have too low odds, given they are in rare structures with not a lot of chests. I think making Eye around a 1/9 chance (similar to desert temples) and making Vex a 1/5 chance (similar to jungle temples) would be good - the stronghold & woodland mansion are incredibly rare, and their current rates mean you are NOT going to find one without searching a ludicrous amount. Alternatively, buff the amount of loot chests in these structures to make it more balanced. The netherite upgrade one is also a bit too rare but i covered that in its own separate feedback article.
maybe it's just me, but the trims only look right in netherite armor, feels weird seing these new textures on the old armor sets, you know

Love the new feature! I think it would be awesome to add echo shards as a material for trimming, would give them a lot more use!

i can't have this armor becase when open de snapshot dont show the new itens and i dont know how resolve this *help*
Diamonds are way to expensive to copy templates, I think amethyst would be better since it doesn’t have many uses and it makes about as much sense as diamonds

One suggestion before I get into some critiques and feedback.

Please make pink and brown available colors in some way. I know there aren't many items to choose from here that fit the aesthetic of using some sort of metal/gemstone/mineral on a Smithing Table that also match these colors, but these are some really nice colors. Maybe use Brick and Nether Brick for pink and brown respectively. I just want to make my Netherite Armor have a pink trim without making all my friends download a resource pack, and brown would bring the total colors from 11 to 12 making it a nice even number.

As for the critiques,

  • The cost of 7 Diamonds should be reduced to 3, removing Diamonds from the corners of the recipe. Or, rather, keep 7 Diamonds in the recipe for the Netherite Armor upgrade template, while making the aesthetic templates take 3 Diamonds (or better yet, 7 of a cheaper resource like Iron/Gold). They are supposed to be rare, but spending dozens of Diamonds to make ONE set of armor look nicer is a little much, especially when you consider the possibilities of large groups of people making uniform sets of armor with the same patterns on each.

I guess that's my only critique. Some additional feedback,

  • Searching the world for templates definitely feels adventurous, it brings more incentive to not just plop a house down somewhere and never leave.
  • The new Smithing Table UI is more intuitive than I expected it to be.
  • The designs look pretty nice. Shouldn't require many changes in that regard.

Ok, the Armor Trim are a beautiful addition. I can now walk by my cluttered cow pen in style.

I know it may be asking for to much and I know some people have already brought it up but,..... why not do the same with more. Add even more ways to express yourself outside of your armor.

Tools: Sure there may only be 3-4 possible Trims to approach them with but I think their addition wouldn't be bad. You could have 1 Trim for the following parts of each tool. Grip/Handle, Eye/Guard, Head/Blade. Maybe even an additional 1 specifically for the sword Pommel. This would also add a way for players to distinguish their enchanted tools by giving them different style/colors of trims without needing to mouse over them to check their enchantments.


Shields: Shield Trims would also be nice and also at the same time fix Banner Patterns breaking on shields. I could see a good couple of ways to approach Trims on shields I think Shield Trims could have variants that only effect the outer area of a shield and ones that have the same effect on the outer area, but also overlaps over the Banner pattern. This allows for another layer of expressing yourself with the already infinite amount on shields.

Horse Armor: I mean, if you are gonna look good your horse has to as well. And this could use the existing Armor Trims that were just added in the snapshot for its patterns.
Adding Goat Horns to Armor Customization

I think instead of a copying system, it would better to make the templates non-consumable but use some sort of "charge" system. Instead of cloning in the crafting table, it would increase the amount of uses a template has before it must be recharged. This will prevent players from accidentally consuming them when they first discover the templates and losing them permanently, and it will give more value to the template itself, similar to how, like another comment mentioned, a music disc.

Shift-Right clicking armor stands should swap your whole attire with the armor stand.
With so many reasons to have multiple sets of armor (elytra, gold in the nether, conflicting enchantments) this would make such an amazing quality of life feature to pair with the new trims.

Armor trims are allready challenging enough to get, they shouldnt be consumeable, and if they are they should not require diamonds an unrenewable resource, while they look pretty i feel like the consumeable part will make players only use them in creative or very late game, also the netherite upgrade should NOT have been changef, netherite was fine where it was it allready required alot of grinding for not much of an armor upgrade and just really a tools upgrade, netherite being far more expensive now feels unrewarding, you finally grinded for all the netherite for ingots just to have to grind for extra diamonds/more upgrade things.
As some mentioned earlier, PLEASE make it possible to use glow ink for these templates so that they glow in the dark, it would be JUST CRAZY

I think armor trims should give very small boosts given how expensive they are.
Iron, diamond and netherite trims should give some defensive boost to any armor. People say this will prompt users to choose the best combination, but people already choose the best armor. This boost however will make low tier armors like gold and chainmail more viable.

Golden trims shouldnt give any defensive boost, but should help with piglins.

As to the other materials, they could have boosts not relating to defense, like extra bubbles with lapiz or extra luck with emerald.
These changes could also be perfect for the future combat update.

Diamonds for duplicating templates is OK, do not change the recipe, it would add at least some use for diamonds for lategame players, because now diamonds are basically useless even compared to gold and iron once you’ve get the whole gear and mending villager…
Minecraft has already became much less challenging in terms of resources accessibility, me personally have STACKS of diamond blocks in my world, I even started to just ignore them when exploring caves, it should definitely NOT be like that.

Moreover, since it just a cosmetic add, it is reasonable for this receipt to be such expensive, it adds some note of prestige. Beside that, some of these templates are extremely hard to get, they can be found in places where you would only go lategame, and very likely to have tons of unused diamonds for which you can fing another use with this update!

As of now, I personally think the current duplicating system is way too expensive for something purely aesthetic as “Armor’s trims” , making the cost 3 diamonds instead of 7 should balance things a little more. As of the Netherite Upgrade, the cost seems balanced enough as it’s something centered around progression(although i’d prefer the cost to be 5 diamonds instead of 7, because sometimes, upgrading your diamond gear to netherite seems such an extra thing and not really that necessary, and i’m afraid with this change it’ll make it a little too grindy to progress and consequently, make players take even longer to even think about upgrading their current diamond gear).

But overall, it’s a very welcome change, and I really enjoy it, just some fixes and it should be almost perfect.

I think it would be better if smithing templates could not be duplicated and not disappear when used. 7 diamonds for a recipe is too high for singleplayer and too low for multiplayer.
and, diamonds do not seem to be related to smithing templates and quality of recipes is not good.

I really love these Armour Trims! I think it will be really rewarding to collect all of them.

My suggestion is that the recipe should be a smithing template, 4 material blocks and 4 diamonds.
This would solve the issue of price and I think looks like it would logically duplicate a template.

Black armor trims shouldn't cost a full Netherite ingot. If they're going to keep with the theme of mining resources (Like Amethyst, Copper, etc) then the cost to trim your armor black should be Coal. Going entirely by trimming costs, the value of a Netherite Ingot is the same as a single bit of Redstone Dust, which doesn't incentivize players to express themselves if they have to go to that length to achieve it, especially for a purely cosmetic upgrade.

Armor trims are looking awesome!
I have some suggestions:

add one for elytra

Hi I just wanted to give my feedback! I hope this helps!

1. The rates of some smithing templates (ST) are too low in my opinion. I had a hard time getting the Ribs, Wild, And Vex smithing templates. And the design of the Coastal ST lead me to believe it was found in buried treasure.

2. I had a lot of fun trying to search for where all the ST’s could be found!

3. I think 7 diamonds is a reasonable requirement for duplication.

4. The interface of the smithing table for applying armor trims was unintuitive to me. Firstly, the fact you have to put in a ST first before any material or armor piece felt weird to me. And secondly, I had difficulty discovering what materials could be used for armor trims. The cycling outline textures lead me to believe that Echo Shards, and Glowstone Dust were applicable. And thirdly, it took me a while to realize you could apply Netherite to armor. I was using Netherite armor as my test armor and thought that since I couldn’t apply Netherite to my current armor, it must not be a material then.

5. To me most of the armor trims are very similar visually, some more variation in design would be nice.

6. It can be overwhelming to decide what armor trim is your favorite at times. Albeit, obtaining access to them all at once doesn’t help.

Sorry this is so long, I just wanted to give a detailed report so that this wonderful feature is the best it can be!

The UI doesn't need to outright tell you what item goes where, seeing as it's already represented visually through silhouettes of the items. The smithing templates also literally have the word "smithing" in them, so it's intuitive to put them in the "smithing" table without the UI telling you directly. The armour stand maybe should be shown from the front, like the banner in a loom. This would make it fit in better with the 2D UI and wouldn't look as weird.

Instead of just reducing the visibility of the enchantment glint, consider changing the color of the enchantment glint to the hue of the trim if a trim exists. That way it wouldn’t conflict with the color of the glint.

First and foremost: HECK YEAH!! I LOVE THIS!! THANK YOU!!

Things I like:

  • A new way to spend diamonds! (we need more of these)
  • A reason to explore more! (we need more of these too)
  • Heck yeah! customizability!

Things I want:

  • Tool/weapon/elytra trims!
  • Better design variety. (too many simple horizontal lines)

Issues that need fixing:

     1. The darker parts of the trim are far too dark. It creates a very muddy and ugly looking effect on some of the colors, especially on gold.

I get it's supposed to look like specular highlight differences, but it just comes across as gross tarnishing instead.

The ribs template is by far the worst offender in this regard. It makes gold look like mud.

An example to look at: Trying to put gold trim on iron armor is just too ugly looking on most templates because of the darkness and muddiness of the darker parts of the trim.

Definitely something that needs fixing.

     2. The smithing table's armor preview isn't lit well. It should be lit from the front and sides, instead of from the top, so that it's easier to see what the designs will actually look like when fully lit. Currently it's difficult to see what the trim looks like in the smithing table.

     3. Advanced tooltips get too big when hovering over templates. It's a result of the item ID's being gigantic. I don't want to turn off advanced tooltips because I look at durability too much, but I also want to be able to see my screen. Not sure what the best solution to this is, but it is a problem.

THANKS!! <3

I like the idea of customizing armor to make it look cooler, but I don't think you should need a netherite armor upgrade template to get netherite gear because it makes obtaining netherite gear a little bit too hard.

I think a better way of making obtaining netherite a more significant achievement would be to increase the amount of netherite ingots needed to upgrade in the smithing table to something like 2 or 3 depending on the armor piece or tool. I think netherite is already hard enough to obtain.

I have 2 feedback items:
1- Having a Template for the base upgrade of Diamond to Netherite is disincentivizing. Netherite is already extremely tedious to obtain, and offers little benefit over Diamond armor. It can still be easily lost in a dual explosion, etc all for minimal durability gain (no extra enchantments, etc). Obtaining multiples of Diamond armor is relatively trivial. So, this takes an already tedious and minimally rewarding task and makes it even harder for no benefit other than being an additional hurdle to cosmetics.

2- The templates cost too much. Diamonds and Netherite can be EXTREMELY difficult to obtain on some servers. It's less of an issue in single player or small shared servers, but on larger very mined out servers it's not easy to obtain at all. This also applies to dropped templates on non-respawnable mobs like Elder Guardians or chests. Either the Template needs to be reusable, or the diamond counts need lowering to one.

Make the "Tide" armor trim easier to obtain please.

To my knowledge, the Tide armor trim is a rare drop from the Elder Guardian, which is a problem in two ways:

1) It's a rare drop from a finite mob

2) It's a rare drop from a powerful monster

Compared to literally every other armor trim, Tide is a rare drop from a mob, a rare mob nonetheless. 

As a solution, I have two ideas:
1) Make the Elder Guardian renewable; create some type of method to respawn it, whether that be natural respawning, or some type of way to resummon it (ex. killing a certain amount of Guardians to anger the monument, and hence respawning the three Elder Guardians).

2) Make the Tide armor trim a rare drop from Buried Treasure instead. Buried treasure already contains Prismarine, alongside other aquatic items, so it could make sense to find the "Tide" armor trim inside of it. Plus, it would also match with all of the other armor trims; being found in a chest.

I think the iron, gold and copper trims should use the raw ore instead of ingots. Minor thing, but seems like the idea here is to encourage exploration, so making it things that can’t be farmed and have to be found in world generation would be aligned.

Using diamonds for its crafting finally gives them use for the late game, though I'm a player that tends do use villagers a lot, and rarely have the need to mine frequently, so I don't think I represent the majority here. I think it's ok to use diamonds to duplicate them, but perhaps slightly reducing the diamond cost on the crafting could be nice.

Besides that, not much to say besides congratulating the team for your hard work and this wonderful feature. Oh, and I'd love to see some customizations for tools and weapons (and Elytras!) too, the 1.20 update is looking great so far :)

The armor trims is great for armor decoration, but it doesn't give me enough motivation to go on a explore to collect it or consume a lot of materials to reproduce it, accidentally obtained armor trims from abandoned structures will only get less and less interesting over time, the armor trims need more uses than just decoration, so i list some uses for each of inlay materials when its inlayed on the armors:


Iron - increase armor protection


Gold - increase armor protection, wont be attack by piglins, can be used for piglin tradement


Copper - reduce lightning damage


Diamond - increase armor protection


Netherite - increase armor protection and knockback resistance


Lapis lazuli - reduce the experience level consumed for armors enchantment

Nether Quartz - reduce the experience points required for armor repairing


Emerald - increase the villagers' trading experience when trading the emerald inlayed armor and can exchange more emeralds


Amethyst - reduce the damage of potions or reduce the duration of potions


Redstone - redstone inlayed armor will emit light when player touching the activated redstones including activated redstone ore


BTW, because netherite ingot can immune to fire, so when player throwing netherite inlayed armor in the lava or died in the lava, it will leave one netherite ingot item on the lava surface, when player placed lava bucket with netherite inlayed armor in the crafting table will crafted into the netherite ingot also

Some opinions about the new system:

1. Echo Shards should be added to the ingredient pool due to their unique colors and little use.

2. Gold trim should have some effect on piglins though.

3. Armor found in a particular structure should have a chance of having a trim of that structure made of one of the materials that belong to the structure's natural loot.

4. The crafting cost of the Netherite Upgrade (referring to diamonds) is fine.  This may be a bit too expensive with the usual Blacksmithing Templates.  I suggest replacing all or part of the diamonds with amethyst for duplicating the Blacksmith Templates.

5. It would be great to be able to apply glow ink to the trim and remove it with regular ink. For this purpose there should be a special smith template, "Ink Primer" which uses both inc sacs as ingredients. Could be found in Abandoned Mines.

6. "Weaving Pattern" could be the equivalent of leather armor using dyes as ingredients.  It could only have a few patterns like "plaid" and appear in spawners underground.

So, I'm completely with this update and am in love with the customization this adds. But if there was one thing I'd like to make note of it is making the player use a template to turn their diamond armor into netherite armor makes netherite far more finite as well as making the process clunky. 
Giving bastions another use is something I'm not against, of course. However, making netherite harder to obtain is something I'm not exactly all for. At its current state, we have 8 (eight) (?) items that need to be made of netherite, and it sounds like the templates are extremely rare. 2 (Two) templates per bastion sounds good for singleplayer, but when you account for the fact that servers tend to have 10+ people nowadays, it makes it have the same issue elytra hunting has.

TLDR ;
Bump the spawning rates of the diamond to netherite conversion templates, please!

or the item you find has durability, and you recharge it with diamonds, infinitely, and can’t break.

There is no reason for a cost to upgrade diamond to netherite. Getting the netherite is already hard enough of a task, needing to pay 7 extra diamond per armour piece is ridiculous and won't encourage using diamond armour, it will discourage using netherite armour. If wanting people to use different armour types is your goal, maybe add special properties to the diamond set instead of taking away from the netherite set. Plus diamonds are a limited resource.

As for the purely cosmetic ones, 7 diamonds is still ridiculous just for a design. Yeah, I know that for both cases you can just go and find enough smithing templates to not need to copy them, but that would probably be too annoying judging by the rarity.

Answering your question, making them expensive doesn't make them feel rare, it makes them feel wasteful, especially when they add nothing other than a cool appearance. Now I don't think they should add anything as that would just result in people using the best ones instead of the ones they like, but it's still important to consider that 7 diamonds for a visual change is too much.

A better way to implement it, in my opinion, would be to exchange diamonds for some other materials that are still rare and also different ones for each design. For example, the upgrades form diamond to netherite could require gold (since it's more in line with the nether) and the rest maybe something special to the biome where they are found. Or maybe reduce the diamonds to 1-2.

But I think the recipe for making the trim multiply is a bit weird; it doesn't make any sense to my why you would need diamonds in order to be able to multiply something like this, because you give it a color with ores, including diamonds. I would like to see another use to multiply the trims, maybe a new item, dye or instead of 7 diamonds the middle item around it and 1 diamonds in the middle.

The way you HAVE to put the trim into the smiting table before you are able to put something else feels a bit weird to me, not sure if this is a bug or intended but it just doesn't make a lot of sense.

Maybe a way to add light to your armor: glowstone, glow ink sac (I think the community is going to like this one), glow berries, something in this category. You can do that the light only glows a little bit for other players, or it actually works like the smooth light you can have with torches in you off hand and shaders.

I am being a little bit picky with these suggestions, because this is just a really cool and unique thing to give players even more reason to explore their world. And who wouldn't like to be creative with your real own armor??

At the moment any armour type below diamond tier almost redundant. It appears mojang has been trying to change this by giving some of the other tiers useful functions (IE: gold detering piglins & leather boots for powdered snow) but I feel they're still quite useless. These armour trims have great potential to make the lower tiers more appealing even in the late game. For example: You could trim leather boots to increase the durability to varying degrees depending on the element used. Perhaps using more expensive things like netherite and the like could even increase protection or give other attributes like knockback resistance. This would late game proof all the lower tier armour sets while not making standard diamond and netherite obsolete. I feel this would be a great change for player expression and armour diversity. Thanks for reading <3

Why can't we put the armor or the ingot/gem if the template slot is empty? Making it so that we can put anything in the smithing table without putting the template first would make it so much more intuitive. For now, it just gets annoying.

Some trims especially in leggings and boots don't feel like there's a difference at all. I don't know how you can make each trim for those pieces look different from one another but yeah for me it's a problem.

7 diamonds to get a copy of a template I think is too much. I'm thinking maybe 5 diamonds instead and use slabs instead of blocks meaning any template that requires a netherrack in its recipe should use a nether brick instead so that you can use slabs and because it just makes sense, too. The color of the template item is more similar to that of the nether brick than the netherrack.

Adding another leggings' worth of diamonds into iron leggings and still ending up with iron leggings seems like a silly equation to me. Maybe the trims should use 2 diamonds to dupe (therefore less than the minimum diamond cost of 4 to make a diamond armor piece) while the netherite upgrade stays at 7.

Please let us use glow ink sacs to make the trims glow in the dark <3. Combining armor and glow ink sac shall be done by crafting. Helmets and boots require 1 glow ink sac while chestplates and leggings would require 2.
It would be cool if we could shine the trim with some glow squid ink, that would give the glow squid another use

Personally not in favor of the change to Netherite, especially if the seven diamond per copy cost sticks around. It would take over a stack of diamonds to upgrade a full set of armor and tools. I understand the desire to make netherite armor and tools more difficult to obtain and add an additional use for diamonds, but this is just adding tedium to something that has worked fine in the game for several years now. Additionally it further disrupts game consistency as netherite would be the only armor/tool set in the game that requires a template.

Requiring a template for the trims is fine as that is a completely new system, although the cost in diamonds for something purely cosmetic is a bit steep. If it stays in its current form, I see this as something that many are excited to do once and then the eagernesses to do it to replacement armor or on new worlds/servers would quickly fade.

just don't lower the price, it's already cheap and there isn't right now a lot of uses for diamond (just because you can trade entire diamond armor and tool sets by 1 emerald with villagers); and if you plan to reduce the cost of the template copies, then nerf the way of getting armor sets from villagers so it is fair
Please make smithing templates renewable!

Not sure if this is 100% a good idea but brainstorming here: What if having all pieces of an armor be trimmed with a certain metarial gave a bonus effect, like a set bonus. This would multiply with armor tier so that players, when setting up their main netherite armor, would be able to "choose a path" to upgrade it in.

For example do they spend most their time trading with villagers? They add full emerald trim to their main set to get a mini overall discount. And this wouldn't be on some throwaway iron set because of the tier multiplier. Do they enchant a lot? Full emerald trim for better enchantability. Do they mine a lot? Full iron trim for slight item magnetism. Gold = peaceful piglins, Netherite = fireproof gear, Diamond = slight resistence etc... 

Just a thought!

An issue I haven't seen brought up yet is old worlds getting this. Most structures in the game, while rare, are infinite. You'll eventually find them while searching the world. Except for Strongholds. There are only 128 strongholds in the game, and in an world pre-1.20, many of those are already going to be explored. Since there is only a 4.8% chance to find the Eye Smithing Template in stronghold chests (which there aren't too many of anyway), it is possible that an entire world would not have a single Eye Smithing Template. I think the chances of finding that specific one should either be upped, or make it so there is at least one Template found in every stronghold (perhaps in the library chest since those are limited to two per Stronghold). Of the ones found in other structures, the Jungle Temple will probably be the most difficult due to the lack of chests it has. I'm looking forward to that search, but perhaps those chances should be slightly upped as well.
Maybe make the lapis lazuli trim a little brighter?

Someone else posted

"I think that maybe armor templates shouldn't be destroyed when used but instead, be put into a broken state like an elytra. Then you would, of course, be able to repair them with related materials. I think this would be better than the copy system that is in the current snapshot as with it being possible to copy templates I feel that they lose some amount of value."

This is a good idea, and there could be fun with this on multiplayer servers with designated service person for each template
My only regret is that there's no way to use dyes. I'd love to use pink dye since I love the color pink but there's no pink minerals.

I find that the duplication recipe for the "Trim" smithing template is a little too expensive. 7 diamonds? For a cosmetic and completely optional feature? 4 diamonds seems much more reasonable to me (maybe even less). At the very least, the recipe of "Trim" smithing template needs to be revised to be more affordable (I also suggest to replace the removed diamond by the "target block" of the recipe).

Attention, I speak only about "Trim" recipe. The recipe for the "Netherite Upgrading" smithing template is him a perfectly valid and balanced cost.

I have a few questions:

  • What if there was an ultra rare variant that allowed the user to utilize a loom to create a custom trim?
  • Perhaps glow squid ink could be added to make the trim glow?
  • Overall, trims feel "fair" in their rarity and use.

I'm not a fan of every trim, but there's something there for everyone.

It would be a nice addition if the trims also could be applied to gold and diamond horse armor and elytra's (if technically possible). Echo shards and Glow Ink should be able to interact with the trims in addition to the current materials. With Echo shards adding a sculk band of the chosen template design to the armor and with the Glow Ink adding a glowing effect based on the chosen material, ex: a gold armor trim with glow ink added would 'glow' in a gold hue (using the same texture effects as the enderman and glow-squid where they appear as glowing but do not emit light.).

I think being able to layer patterns like you can with banner patterns would be neat, and would add more personality to it, as well as add more creativity! maybe right clicking a trimmed armor on a cauldron filled with lava could remove a trim layer, the same way water in a cauldron does with a banner. I also think that having the trim type themselves being NBT driven could solve the whole duplication thing as well like for example, with it being NBT driven you can have a new (which would replace the template items) item called "Blank Template" and with it being NBT driven you can add new Trim items for your new Trims via datapacks Which would be very useful! cause as is right now, to add a new trim pattern you need to use an item that can be found in survival/a command only item which could be used in an unintended way

so, to summarize, I think the Smithing Template type should be NBT driven It'll allow for so much more creativity via datapacks & resourcepacks. having a generic "smithing template" item would, imo, fix the whole duplication crafting situation, you could possibly get these generic smithing templates from the smithing villager, or from piglin bartering so it's renewable...
I think it’d be better to put the dune trim in the desert well. That would give a currently useless structure some use

Make wandering traders actually useful by putting templates as things they have a chance trading. It makes sense because wandering traders go around the world exploring and they are likely to find these templates and trade them. This would also help slightly with the cost of duplicating the templates.

Everything seems incredible to me, a very good idea! but there is something that worries me, it does not seem profitable to me to use a netherite ingot for a simple decoration, it would be great if putting netherite in a gold/diamond/iron/chain armor would be better than a common armor, I don't know what If it protects a little more it would be great...
Could prismarine crystal be one of the possible colours for it? Maybe something similar to cyan. And maybe netherite scrap for brown?

I like the armor trims! I have a few thoughts:

  • A few people have mentioned that the current recipe for duplicating trims is too expensive. I think I agree--it costs almost as much as a diamond chestplate just to recreate a single trim. One possible way to offset this would be to make it possible for smithing villagers to recreate specific trims as a trading recipe.
  • I think the trims would look really good on leather armor and would love to see that added to the game. Alternatively, it would be cool if we could overlay a material onto an armor to change the base color of the armor. That way we could overlay leather or gold onto diamond armor without losing the protection benefits.
  • I hope the trims give us functional upgrade options in the future! While I really love the cosmetic upgrades, it would be cool to add additional functions to armor as well. Some ideas include torch helmets, elytra chestplates, or slime boots. These could be crafted with a smithing template and the appropriate item and give armor permanent effects.
I agree with another person in the sense of using glow squid ink for armor trims. Glowing armor would be so cool. Plus, you could play a pretty sick game of laser tag

I really like the upgrades now! It makes me wish it had been like this when netherite initially came out so i didn't have to adjust, but i rly love this concept. It makes netherite feel more valuable. I also love the duplication for the templates as that lets me have another use for my diamonds and doesn't exhaust my exploring efforts.
Honestly, no complaints other than maybe rly wanting to see dungeon spawners getting an update with special loot too. I love all the value these templates add to structures, and I'd love for one of our oldest structures to get some more love

I really like the customization options this brings out, but what if we could also customize our tools and weapons also? It would give more options of personalization to every players armour combo's and such. Maybe also add some customization to elytra and shields as well?

The Smithing Templates just add innovatory clutter trim would be better if it was rare items from a region like…the Pug Step album to apply the snout trim and the nautilus shell or heart of the sea for the coast trim and a block of emerald gold diamond copper or lapis to apply there trims also the smithing table isn’t very intuitive with the new trim maybe more spacing between the slots and the armor should always be the first slot the ovject to be upgraded the second slot and the pattern the third slot thank you for your time

7 dimonds is too expensive. If its too expensive No one is ever going to trim iron or gold armor. If it is purely cosmetic, I don't see why you would want to make ut an endgame item. It also makes Nethrite armor too expensive, there are already a lot of players who don't upgrade because of the hassle of finding ancien debris when Netherite is not that much better than dimond. I get it is for the flex, but it's only going to make less people want to use Netherite armor/tools. One thing that could make it worth the 7 diamonds is if the trim design/material added secondary effects. Just dont require that the effects require a full matching set because that would reduce the number of viable combinations.

I think echo shards should be able to be used. It gives echo shards more than one purpose and you can make the armor have an animated texture for its trim. I think it would look very nice. Other potential materials could be sea lantern shards. This could provide a luminescent texture for the trim which would also be very nice.

One suggestion I would have would be for datapacks.

This would be a good opportunity to add CustomModelData for armor & tools, as well as the ability to use items with CustomModelData in crafting recipes.

They are super neat, but it would be even cooler if they had a function (even if small) for example giving more armor/durability/speed/or other ideas (this way a nice golden armor which has Ben trimed with netherite can be used, else it would be pointless)

In my opinion, I think there are too many template icons.

It's really creative that you have to go to a ton of different structures to get them, but adding too many items to the game makes it quite busy.

I enjoy how they handled the banner patterns and the firework rockets, and maybe it could be cool to use existing items to add trims to armor, kind of like Stardewvalley.

But the Mojang devs have done a great job and it's a very cool idea that should only receive praise!

I think it is currently sitting in the perfect spot for late game rewards, price, time, and effort. However if it is meant to be used more throughout gameplay then I think its a bit too much. I prefer the late game reward all that being said. I really like the idea that a year from now I could find one of these in my world and get excited.  a lot of loot late game is just not exciting and I think this is great. Perhaps some of the loot table percentages could change. For example the elder gaurdian drop should probably be 30%  so that the reward is given when you take on a underwater monument and kill all 3 of the elder gaurdians its more likely you get the reward. 
Some suggestions rather than feedback 
-Horse Armor Trim
-Echo Shard as a Trim Material, adding more value to them and again increasing player interaction with the deep dark
-Tool Customization
-Other trims for structures that were not included, totally grateful for what we have and we would like more

I’m concerned about their rarity on multiplayer servers, a greedy player could nab them all first and not be willing to share any clones, even if they’re made repairable like another user suggested in a previous comment. They also seem a bit too rare in general.

I think an alternate way to grab them could be as rare loot from mobs, i.e. dune templates as rare drops from husks, or rib templates from wither skeletons (on top of their current loot, so other rare drops like skulls aren’t interfered with; maybe rib templates could drop more commonly from the Wither, too). A new way for players to respawn Elder Guardians (no natural respawn) could be introduced as well.

I know this could be grindy and tedious though, so I’m not completely sure about it, but the current method of obtaining them seems tedious too if you’re unlucky (just grind exploration time far away from your home instead of mob drops), and as mob drops they’re at least more renewable. Perhaps their loot chances could be increased a bit, at least.

Aside from that, I think they’re all pretty cool!

The insane diamond requirements I like for netherite, because that makes it feel more rare, but locking a cosmetic change behind a huge amount of diamonds is really bad. I personally would just change the recipe to make it actually look like the templates, with 1 diamond in the center and the respective block around it.
Not sure if this is coming but I would love to see a villager and wandering trader sell these
really cool, maybe add a function where you can make the trims glow (emissive) by adding glow ink to them after the fact
I think it would be nice if either gold trim or the pattern found in the bastions could pacify the piglins like gold armor removing the need to swap down to gold in the late game

Although I really like the update, the cost and rarity of the smithing templates feels very bad for casual players. Having done some looking around myself, the templates seem way too rare in structures especially considering they only have a cosmetic purpose.

The chance of them in chests should really be bumped up a lot or have a single one guaranteed in more structures than just the treasure room bastion. Something that purely makes the player look cool shouldn't be this dependent on RNG initially.

The cost for duplicating all templates seems too high as well and the reasons for the netherite upgrades being harder to obtain don't really make a lot of sense to me. You can easily beat the game in diamond armour so I don't see why netherite has to be a more significant milestone (and more dependent on RNG and more of a chore). I'd probably want it to cost maybe 3 or 4 diamonds per duplication, or maybe use a different material. Maybe the echo shards would work since they already have some use in duplicating things. Or perhaps the templates could have a durability of 3 or something.

That being said I really like the redesigned smithing table and the trims themselves are great too.

One other suggestion I have is that the enchantment glint could have a client-side option in the options menu for its strength like the darkness effect slider.

Very excited for this new feature! My one piece of feedback is that I feel like the rib trim is supposed to look cool but it kinda looks too stripy and perhaps a bit too dim.
i love them, only thing is that i would like to see a tool trim, and applying armor trims of the same materials (like diamond on diamond)

I would like to see more color options.

  • Charcoal for a dark gray color (lighter than Netherite)

I think it'd be great to have another gem for an armor trim effect, mainly echo shard applying a glow to the trim, so that in darkness players would be able to see the glow of it, just like glow squids are visible in complete darkness. Absolutely love the trims, only one small thing. I think trims should be reuseable and craftable, to make them a bit less rare / expensive. You could keep the same recipe used to dupe it, but have a certain item be in the place of the trim item.

This new system is amazing! I have some points of feedback I wanted to share:
1) As some people commented before, some trims could also use the detail layer on the texture, making them pop out more. This could also make armor trims being usable on the same material, as they'd still clearly appear.
2) This should be applicable to horse armor! Horses have not been getting a lot of love for a while now, with their breeding still broken (almost impossible to make a perfect horse without it spawning naturally, disencouranging breeding in favor of searching).
Something as simple as armor trims for them would revive some interest! Could also be an opportunity to have Netherite horse armor!
3) Some other special trims would be nice! Stuff like coal and prismarine would make for some banger trims, and they also fit the ore theme! If you are willing to give up a bit of consistency for visuals though, you could even go as far as allowing magma block and crying obsidian trims!

Amazing feature! Some small tweaks I would consider-

-Slightly cheaper to duplicate

-Move some textures up on the chestplate- looks weird to decorate the belly of the player

-Add prismarine crystal color to the table

-(out-there suggestions) Change enchantment effect on armors; allow for customization of enchantment aura; add weapon color customization.

Duplicating trims is pretty expensive. Instead of changing the recipe tho I'd suggest to make it give you 4 trims instead of 2 so you have enough to trim a whole set of armor. Netherite is ok. Overall this is an amazing update and makes exploration much more rewarding.

Some of us might not be able to get the strongholds trims. If there isn’t any real reason not too I’d like stronghold to just generate indefinitely instead of having a final circle. It would allow us to get the trim if we aren’t able to and give players with worlds out stretching thousands or millions of blocks an easier way back to spawn.
certainly should increase armor protection after adding a new ore to it, and I think that could happen with swords too, and even add new melee weapons

As a perk for going through the danger of getting trimmed armor, the XP cost of repairing and enchanting trimmed armor should be half as expensive as non-trimmed armor. This would allow the player more time to find and apply mending to their favorite trims before the dreaded "Too Expensive" message is displayed when using the anvil.

Armor trims duplications are way too expensive. I get that these recipes are this way to make diamonds more useful but for something that is purely cosmetic and even can be applied to iron armor it shouldn’t be this costly. It essentially becomes a late game item, maybe just one diamond per duplicate would be ok. I think some people like that is rare and requires effort to get them but I think there are plenty of players that can’t be on Minecraft frequently because of school, work or even other games or hobbies. Please keep in mind this since there are many of us who can’t be playing all the time and some trims already demonstrate what players are the ones putting more effort on the game like the ones found in ancient cities and bastion remnants. I don’t think making them more accessible to duplicate and less time consuming would make it less fun, quite the opposite: I think more people get to enjoy this new fantastic feature if done this way
I think adding a toggle to turn enchantment glint off completely would help show off the trims even more.
"Ribs" Template textrure should be retextured, they are just awful and very dark

For Singleplayer, I feel the Smithing Templates are too common. For Multiplayer, they will more than likely become a rare item. Does being able to copy them do make sense. However, the Diamonds in the recipe does not make them feel very special. Diamonds already have their place as currency on servers, so what about giving more purpose to an item that seems magical, I'd say Amethyst, but what about Echo Shards?

Searching for these Smithing Templates is a fun adventure! I have already found 7 of them.

When putting items into the Smithing Table, you can't add the Ingridient or Armour before the Template. Which makes it feel less intuitive. Maybe disable those slots visually or allow for any item to go in as per normal?

The only Trim I did not see fit with the others was the Rib Armor Trim. Not because it looked bad, just that the shade of the color did not match the others. It looked darker. However, I still want to keep it! Could we perhaps have another decor item that has this dark color?

This feature is amazing, and I feel very creative with it. Also feel gold trim should prevent Piglins from chasing you.

Would love to see this apply to Leather Armor and Dyed Leather Armor as well as Horse Armour including Leather and Dyed Leather. Perhaps even Shulker Boxes, Tools, Weapons as well.

I for one feel that this is one of the best and most creative additions to the game in some time!, only 2 suggestions, one being a change and the other being an addition

Change - the sprites of the templates look, off? in a way, and I much prefer the look of the netherite upgrade template look, maybe that look, or something that resembles scrap could be a better look

I think there should be some functionality to using them, but they look good and are interesting.
Gold trims should stop piglins from getting aggro at the player

Using the smithing table to apply upgrades/trims is intuitive, but I dislike the method of duplicating these templates. Perhaps a repairable "broken" or "used" state of each of the templates, similarly to the elytra, would prevent accidental losses of them.

I like the idea that instead of vanishing on use, the templates have a broken state similar to elytra. The repair cost could just be the same as the duplication cost. That way instead of duplicating indefinitely, the templates would maintain their scarcity on servers and you wouldn’t run the risk of accidentally using your last one.

This idea might be out of scope, but I think It would be really cool to give a full sets of armor trims some uses if you manage to make different sets of armors. A Full Set Of Trimed Emerald Armor: Causes Villager trading to be slight cheaper
